wikipedia_page.main: Raymond Llewellyn Mawby (6 February 1922 – 22 July 1990) was a British Member of Parliament for the Conservative Party and a junior Minister, who was in the pay of 2nd Directorate of the General Staff of the Czechoslovak People's Army, the military intelligence service of the Czechoslovak Socialist Republic.

response: In 1969, Stonehouse was subjected to the assertion that he was a Czechoslovak secret service agent. He successfully defended himself,. but the allegation was substantiated in the official history of MI5, The Defence of the Realm (2009) by Cambridge historian Christopher Andrew.Richard Norton-Taylor "MI5 monitored union and CND leaders with ministers' backing, book reveals", The Guardian, 5 October 2009 In December 2010, it was revealed that, in 1980, then-Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher had agreed to cover up revelations that Stonehouse had been a Czechoslovak spy since the 1960s as there was insufficient evidence to bring him to trial.. Until Ray Mawby, briefly a member of a Conservative government, was exposed in June 2012,Gordon Corera  "Tory MP Raymond Mawby sold information to Czech spies", BBC News, 28 June 2012 Stonehouse was the only Minister known to have been an agent for the former Eastern bloc.
